thread.title: You Won't Believe Explosions in the Sky's New Video Is Stop-Motion
thread.title_full: You Won't Believe Explosions in the Sky's New Video Is Stop-Motion

author: Nathaniel Ainley
title: You Won't Believe Explosions in the Sky's New Video Is Stop-Motion
text:
You Won't Believe Explosions in the Sky's New Video Is Stop-Motion Director Hayley Morris creates awe-inspiring graphics out of cut-paper sculptures. 
Using a craft knife and some glue, filmmaker Hayley Morris builds amazing abstract scenes from cut-out construction paper for " The Ecstatics ," the new music video for Explosions in the Sky. Morris employs the same stop-motion formula that made her music videos for Iron and Wine and Pure Bathing Culture so successful, with simple camera tricks and her prowess as a cinematographer turning her static paper sculptures into expressive and mesmerizing video graphics. Human silhouettes fan out into patterned paper planes that play with light and shadow in a way that pushes their forms into abstraction. Morris also incorporates small glass-blown pieces that ultimately merging with the surrounding wave of paper. 
Check out the video in full below: 
"The Ecstatics" is a single off the Explosions in the Sky's seventh studio album, The Wilderness , which hit #9 on Billboard top albums list. 
You can pick up The Wilderness on BandCamp and check out more work by Hayley Morris on her website . Explosions in the Sky is about to head out on on tour. Catch them live in your city in the coming months: 
4/6/17 - San Antonio, TX - Paper Tiger 4/7/17 - Baton Rouge, LA - Varsity Theatre 4/8/17 - Mobile, AL - Soul Kitchen 4/9/17 - Birmingham, AL - Iron City 4/10/17 - Tallahassee, FL - The Moon 4/12/17 - St. Petersburg, FL - Jannus Live 4/13/17 - Athens, GA - Georgia Theatre 4/14/17 - Athens, GA - Georgia Theatre 4/15/17 - Asheville, NC - Orange Peel 4/16/17 - Nashville, TN - Ryman Auditorium 4/18/17 - Baltimore, MD - Rams Head Live 4/19/17 - Baltimore, MD - Rams Head Live 4/20/17 - New Haven, CT - College Street Music Hall 4/21/17 - Providence, RI - Lupo's 4/22/17 - Port Chester, NY - Capitol Theatre 4/23/17 - Toronto, TN - Rebel 4/26/17 - Cleveland, OH - House of Blues 4/27/17 - Grand Rapids, MI - Covenant Fine Arts Center 4/28/17 - St Louis, MO - The Pageant 4/29/17 - Oklahoma City, OK - Criterion Theater
